intro: Scleranthus decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in dry, open habitats such as sandy soils and disturbed areas. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions. Scleranthus decipiens is often mistaken for other similar species due to its deceptive appearance and growth habits.
